name: Mount Field

trails_config.name: Avalon, Field, and Willey Loop
trails_config.description: A high-altitude ridge walk connecting three peaks. Mount Field is the junction point of the Willey Range and is known for friendly Gray Jays that often greet hikers.
trails_config.parking_info: AMC Highland Center Parking, US-302, Carroll, NH

current_conditions.ai_summary: A spectacular hike located in New Hampshire. Standing at 4340 feet, Mount Field offers breathtaking views and a rewarding challenge for hikers of all levels.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4340 feet, Mount Field is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Avalon, Field, and Willey Loop**, a **6.5 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Mount Avalon**, which is just 0.6 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
